event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A fatal error was detected within a MBC chip.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
A fatal error was detected within a MBC chip.


SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:


      This fault can occur on the MBC chip that resides on the Motherboard.
      The platform is reset and becomes unbootable.



   SPARC Enterprise M4000 platform:


      This fault can occur on the MBC chip that resides on the Motherboard.

      The fault may affect the the entire MBC chip or it may affect just a
      single XSB; this can be determined by looking at the FMRI of the fault.

      If the fault affects only a single XSB, then the fault may only affect
      the portion of the MBC chip that affects the TTY (console) control; this
      can be determined by looking at the ereport class of the ereport associated with the fault.

      If this is a MBC internal fault that affects the entire MBC chip,
      then the platform is reset and the platform becomes unbootable.

      If this is a MBC internal fault that affects a single XSB and the fault is not
      on the TTY-oriented portion of the XSB chip, then the domain using the XSB is reset
      and the XSB is deconfigured.

      If this is a MBC internal fault that affects a single XSB and the fault is
      on the TTY-oriented portion of the MBC chip, then nothing is deconfigured.



   SPARC Enterprise M5000 platform:


      This fault can occur on the MBC chip that resides on the Motherboard.

      The fault may affect the the entire MBC chip or it may affect just a
      single XSB; this can be determined by looking at the FMRI of the fault.
 
      If the fault affects only a single XSB, then the fault may only affect
      the portion of the MBC chip that affects the TTY (console) control; this
      can be determined by looking at the ereport class of the ereport associated with the fault.

      If this is a MBC internal fault that affects the entire MBC chip,
      then the platform is reset and the platform becomes unbootable.

      If this is a MBC internal fault that affects a single XSB and the fault is not
      on the TTY-oriented portion of the MBC chip, then the domain using the XSB is reset
      and the XSB is deconfigured.

      If this is a MBC internal fault that affects a single XSB and the fault is
      on the TTY-oriented portion of the MBC chip, then nothing is deconfigured.



   SPARC Enterprise M8000/M9000 platforms:


      This fault can occur on the MBC chip that resides on the CMU.

      The fault may affect the the entire MBC chip or it may affect just a
      single XSB; this can be determined by looking at the FMRI of the fault.

      If the fault affects only a single XSB, then the fault may only affect
      the portion of the MBC chip that affects the TTY (console) control; this
      can be determined by looking at the ereport class of the ereport
      associated with the fault.

      If this is a MBC internal fault that affects the entire MBC chip,
      then the domains using the CMU are reset and the CMU is deconfigured.

      If this is a MBC internal fault that affects a single XSB and the fault is not
      on the TTY-oriented portion of the XSB chip, then the domain using the XSB is reset
      and the XSB is deconfigured.

      If this is a MBC internal fault that affects a single XSB and the fault is
      on the TTY-oriented portion of the MBC chip, then nothing is deconfigured.





The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:21:11 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: a09fd666-4889-4deb-a5ae-30a734345f86
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8003-HA for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8003-HA, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:21:11 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: a09fd666-4889-4deb-a5ae-30a734345f86
   DESC: A fatal error was detected within a MBC chip.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8003-HA for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: Resources associated with the faulty FRU will be deconfigured. Please consult the
   detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   IMPACT: Either the platform will be reset or a domain may be reset. The platform may become unbootable.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command

   
   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u a09fd666-4889-4deb-a5ae-30a734345f86

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 20 21:21:11.9008 a09fd666-4889-4deb-a5ae-30a734345f86 SCF-8003-HA
           100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.asic.mbc.fe

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/mbc=0
                    Affects: -
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                             server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                             part=CA20393-B50X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/MBU_B


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: Either the platform will be reset or a domain may be reset. The platform may become unbootable. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: Resources associated with the faulty FRU will be deconfigured. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Fatal error was detected within a MBC chip.
